title: Immersive Technology Integration Workshop for Strengthening Leadership Competencies in Higher Education Administrators

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of elementary education policies and administrative tasks
context.additional_context: Leadership training program for corporate education managers to strengthen social responsibility

learning_goals: Over six months, learners can perform VR/AR-based conflict management simulations (four scenarios: inter-team task conflicts, customer complaint resolution, etc.) twice a month, meet at least four out of five evaluation checklist items per scenario, and write feedback reflection reports incorporating peer/instructor feedback.
Experience decision-making processes in educational settings using smartphone-based augmented reality (AR) tools.
Design a formative assessment system for evaluating social competencies (communication, collaboration, problem-solving) required in the digital age.

Within six months, learners can develop a 10-item checklist-based framework evaluating corporate job competencies (leadership, problem-solving, collaboration) aligned with EQF (European Qualifications Framework) Level 4-5 standards and receive validity verification of over 80% from an internal expert panel.

Within six months, learners can select three low-cost immersive learning solutions applicable in a limited technical environment (one smartphone with internet access), and write a report including implementation plans (learning scenarios, budget plans, effectiveness evaluation metrics) for each solution.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
